title: Update Discover Filters sheet with min/max category and Uruguay department zone

requirements.summary: Replace the existing single “Filtrar por” selector in the Discover filters sheet with three inputs: Minimum category (1st–7th), Maximum category (1st–7th), and Zone (All departments + Uruguay departments).
acceptanceCriteria: Opening the Filters sheet shows three controls (Minimum category, Maximum category, Zone) in the same location where the existing “Filtrar por” selector currently appears.
Minimum category and Maximum category each offer exactly 7 options (1st, 2nd, 3rd, 4th, 5th, 6th, 7th).
Zone offers “All departments” plus the full set of Uruguay departments (no missing entries).

file_operations.description: Replace the current single shadcn/ui Select control (“Filtrar por”) with three controls in the same area: Minimum category Select (1st–7th), Maximum category Select (1st–7th), and Zone Select (defaulting to “All departments” plus Uruguay departments). Use the shadcn-ui Select/Label components for consistent UI. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Define and export the category option list for 1st through 7th (exactly 7 options) to keep DiscoverFilters rendering consistent and reusable.

requirements.summary: Create a reusable explicit list of Uruguay departments and render them as selectable Zone options with “All departments” as default.
acceptanceCriteria: The Zone dropdown contains these 19 departments: Artigas, Canelones, Cerro Largo, Colonia, Durazno, Flores, Florida, Lavalleja, Maldonado, Montevideo, Paysandú, Río Negro, Rivera, Rocha, Salto, San José, Soriano, Tacuarembó, Treinta y Tres.
The default Zone selection is “All departments”.

file_operations.description: Add and export a single source-of-truth array containing the 19 Uruguay departments (exact spellings from acceptance criteria) for reuse by the Discover Zone dropdown.

Import and use the reusable Uruguay departments list to render the Zone Select options, ensuring “All departments” is present and used as the default selection. Use shadcn-ui Select components. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Persist the three filter selections in DiscoverScreen state and pass them to DiscoverFilters so selections remain when closing/reopening the sheet and can be changed independently.
acceptanceCriteria: Changing any of the three filter controls updates Discover screen state and the selected values remain visible when the sheet is closed and reopened.
Minimum category, Maximum category, and Zone can be set independently without UI breakage.

file_operations.description: Replace the single `filters` state with three independent pieces of state: `minCategory`, `maxCategory`, and `zone` (default zone: “All departments”). Pass these values and dedicated change handlers down to DiscoverFilters so the sheet can be closed/reopened without losing selections, and so each control updates independently. Keep candidate discovery fetching behavior unchanged (no server-side filtering changes in this task).

Update DiscoverFilters props to accept `minCategory`, `maxCategory`, and `zone` plus corresponding onChange callbacks, and bind the three Select controls to those props so the visible selections reflect DiscoverScreen state. Use shadcn-ui Select/Label components. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
